extra.enrollment_requirement: PREREQUISITE    A Grade of C+ in 6.0 units from HIST 300-329 and registration in a HIST Major or Medial Plan.

basic.description: Examines the colonial state in India in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, with a focus on the colonial manifestations of utilitarianism, liberalism and domesticity; and the relationship between power and knowledge as seen in language, anthropology, law, medicine. Other topics include concepts of modernity, nationalism and postcoloniality.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Colonial India: The State, Knowledge and Power
